definitions.definition: To run together; to articulate poorly .
examples: to slur syllables;  He slurs his speech when he is drunk.

definitions.definition: To play legato or without separate articulation; to connect (notes) smoothly.
To soil ; to sully ; to contaminate ; to disgrace .
To cover over; to disguise; to conceal; to pass over lightly or with little notice.
To cheat, as by sliding a die ; to trick.
To blur or double , as an impression from type ; to mackle .

secondary_definitions: To run together; to articulate poorly .
( music ) To play legato or without separate articulation; to connect (notes) smoothly.
To soil ; to sully ; to contaminate ; to disgrace .
To cover over; to disguise; to conceal; to pass over lightly or with little notice.
To cheat, as by sliding a die ; to trick.
( printing , dated ) To blur or double , as an impression from type ; to mackle .
